newsitem.title: UK: FSU oil exports up 240,000 in Jan to 2.87 mbpd - IEA.
newsitem.headline: FSU oil exports up 240,000 in Jan to 2.87 mbpd - IEA.

text.p: Net oil exports from the territories of the former Soviet Union rose 240,000 barrels per day (bpd) from December to an unseasonally high 2.87 million bpd, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Friday.
Exports were 460,000 bpd higher than in January of last year, the IEA said in a monthly oil market report.
Crude exports were up 310,000 bpd on the month to 2.38 million while product exports were down 70,000 bpd at 490,000 bpd.
Seaborne exports from Baltic and Black Sea ports were up 260,000 bpd from December to 1.95 million bpd. Druzhba pipeline exports were down a little at one million bpd.
The Russian government's export schedule sees 2.05 million bpd of crude exports in the first quarter of 1997, aournd 600,000 bpd higher than in the first quarter last year, the IEA said.
